answers.answer: I don't know if tyrosine can cause this -- would stop it unless prescribed for a medical condition.  Follow-up with your doctor on this.  This is not likely a thyroid problem.Would also ask doctor about diabetes insipidus (not related to blood sugar, that's diabetes mellitus).
wouldn't my doctor have mentioned that to me....i am waiting on the results from my blood work re/ kidneys.thyrod all that stuff

question: WENT TO THE DOCTOR YESTERDAY TOOK A BLOOD TEST DO NOT HAVE DIABETES...HOWEVER I'M THIRSTY ALL THE TIME...RECENTLY STARTES TAKING 2000MG OF LTYROSINE DO YOU THINK THIS CAN BE CAUSING THE PROBLEM...ALSO WAS TAKING VICODIN FOR  CHRONIC BACK PROBLEMS...NO LONGER ARE TAKING THAT.
title: ALWAYS THIRSTY
